Posted: January 18
Early Access Review
Fast-paced Turn-based Fun Place!What's this? The Behemoth, the creators of my favorite beat-em-up and one of my favorite platformers, made a turn-based game? Sign me up!I'm a fan of turn-based games with RPG elements: the Fallout games by Interplay, Wasteland, Fire Emblem, the works. Seeing this game annouced, I was a little skeptical. Specifically, about the co-op features. Many turn-based games with co-op have each player move individually. But I'll be beaten down with a rubber hose filled with frozen custard if The Behemoth didn't make it work.I can easily compare the gameplay to Fire Emblem, but boiled down to what's important. No faffing about with the weapon triangle for Pit People! Bigger weapons do more damage but weigh more. Archers aren't effective at close range. Maces work better on armored foes. Ultimately, the secret to success is how you position your soldiers on the field. Different squads can mesh together in different ways, allowing for interesting stratigies that work for you.The humor is nothing new if you've played Behemoth's previous, with the glorious glorious voice of Stamper, the narrator in Battleblock Theatre, making a return as the narrator. This time around he's made out to be super sarcastic and passive-aggressive towards the protagonists. It's truly a joy to behold the dialouge. But as they say, the devil's in the details. Pit People has a lot of tiny details that make it much more enjoyable. For example, each unit type has a special entry corralating to them. And the entries are just an absolute joy.This game is a-okay in my book!

I highly recommend this game to any fan of The Behemoth, or just anyone in general.

Posted: January 16
Early Access Review
								I wasn't sure what to expect, I'm a huge fan of Castle Crashers & Battleblock Theater, but I'm not a fan of turn based games. This however, is a different story, I love this game, even in early access, it feels EXTRMELEY polished and is a joy to play, both solo and with a friend.There's tons of hilarious items to use, tons of Behemoth humor that I love, and tons of detail to the maps/arenas. As for the gameplay, it feels arcade-y, without losing a smidge of any strategic elements, which is very hard to do. Then there's the 'hub' where they have an Arena, Online, Item Shop, Character/Group Customization, which of course, is dislayed in a humerous style (I wont spoil). The map roaming is perfect for this game, lots of content, lots of things to fight, plenty of quests and side quests to do, none of which are filler. Props to The Behemoth for creating another awesome, masterfully crafted game that I need to recommend!

Posted: January 22
Early Access Review
								The Behemoth is back!I've been a huge fan of this studio since Newgrounds, have played everything they have developed up to this point, and I have to say that Pit People is turning out to be one of the best efforts they have ever made. Castle Crashers was amazing for unlocks and playing through multiple times to find all of the nuances and secrets lying underneath, but after 30-40 hours you have done and seen most of what the game has to offer. Pit People is so different in that aspect, as there are literally 1,000+ items to unlock, a multitude of different characters and species to "recruit", and a billion reasons to sink your time into this game.As Early Access, the game gives you a very limited view of what is in store for the main story experience, but it vastly makes up for this with an addictive but accessible PVP and super-hard Co-Op pit mode. Not to mention the huge open world that seems to have a lot to discover, and plenty of creatures to add to your team as mentioned before.There are a few noticable and jarring UI problems with this game. For one, a lot of the stat management and overviews for characters are incredibly subtle. At first, I had no idea that leveling your recruits mattered. There's no representation of your stats growing or what the growth per individual species would be. You'll especially notice this once you recruit a Mascot species type, as their attack damage on the stats page reads a huge number above all other species, but they merely buff other characters and don't do the damage stated on their page. There needs to be more ways to differenciate between the different Clops or Humans you recruit, as well as stat comparison to someone you're wanting to swap in on your team before taking on PvP or the World Map. The UI is also very difficult to manage with a mouse + keyboard. I have been playing most of this game with the Steam Controller, and I find that method of play to be a lot more enjoyable. Playing on my laptop with a mouse and keyboard, or even my main PC, was a challenge. There's no visual feedback when you're nearing the edge of the screen in the main hub for bulding selections other than a "click your mouse" prompt, and you usually find yourself running between buildings often trying to make a simple selection. There are plenty of other examples of the UI being incredibly clunky and vague, like the Quest Selection page before you depart to the world. I had to take a few moments to grasp what they wanted me to do.I've put a good amount of hours into this game so far, and I cannot wait to see what they bring to the table with it. Definitely one of the better Early Access titles I have ever played. I see this game having such potential for updates, maybe little DLC packs for new character stories or mission packs. Hell, maybe even release these quarterly for free. I can also see a potential competitive scene emerging from this game once all the balancing has been ironed out, and most of the gameplay has been tweaked a bit.I will update this review when the game goes live, but I would highly recommend you buy this if you are on the fence about it. I would say 80% of the game is there, and what is included is well worth the $15 asking price.To the Pits!

Posted: January 24
Early Access Review
								After loving the other games of Behemoth and my girlfriend showing me this game, I immediately bought it. Since I love turn-based strategy games & play them a lot, I feel that I can give a proper review for what this game offered so far. The game itself is punny as Behemoth tends to do, which I hope they never quit doing. The offered missions & stories are good enough at the moment to already play the game for several hours. Although it felt to me like a demo that they could've given out for free to promote the game when it's finished.The gameplay is fun with the RNG implemented, as you only control their movement, not their actions. Which gives it a fun luck-factor where you could have a fun rage-moment when they hit the wrong target for the 5th time.The local co-op is really clunky atm unfortunately, the camera moves too much since it tries to focus on 2 moving cursors at the same time, which sortof forces you to do your movements 1 person at a time. Basically you could play for 2 people on your own, if you have 2 seperate controllers that is. I wasn't able to test the online co-op yet & will propably update my review after I tested that.Something negative I noticed is that currently, being in Early Access, it feels like the characters their stats don't go up after a while anymore, having a lvl 30 character feels the same as having a level 10. The damage seems to lock at a certain point, even if the game assured that the stats would keep going up.This does give an advantage on enjoying the 'demo' to its full extend, since else the level 5 missions would become too easy, thus ruining the gameplay.I strongly suggest this 'demo' to everyone who enjoyed Behemoth's previous games & people who like comedic strategy games. The full game probably won't dissappoint.

Posted: January 22
Early Access Review
								Just what you'd expect from The Behemoth. This game is amazing! Despite it being early access and in reality there is very little to it right now, I've had a lot of fun with it.IF YOU BUY THIS EARLY, DO KNOW THAT THERE IS ONLY THE GENERAL SET OF TUTORIAL QUESTS AND WHAT FEELS LIKE ONLY 1 REAL STORY QUEST. Most of my time playing has been spent just grinding out battles in order to level up my team, otherwise there really isn't much else to do other than the Unfair Pit and repeatable bonus missions. The Unfair Pit seems quite fun, but even with a full team of above level 20's I barely made it past round 1 and it could also be noted that I'm probably not amazing at the game anyway. As far as random encounters go, I feel like it would be nice to see even more variety in some of the enemies. There are a few different races you encounter throughout the game, but the only difference between characters of the same race are there helmets mostly and even then it really isn't all that crazy. Each race of character has their own style of attacking and special attributes, and there are actually quite a few different races, but after playing for awhile I would either get a lack of variety in the enemies I was facing or cool races just wouldn't show up at all. This game is early access so I wasn't expecting it to be all together or anywhere near a complete game. I've had a lot of fun with the game so far, but until its full releases I don't think I'll be playing too much now. I absolutely recommend getting this game now while it's cheaper though. It is an insane amount of fun and it's only in early access so it can only get better from here.

Early Access Review
								I had to step back a bit when the game opened up to think about how I felt about your units deciding who to attack and that you have to get a Spanish Conquistador to capture enemies in her net to collect more units for your squad pokemon style but I'd say it's pretty special.I think it'll be worth saving your purchase until after Early Access, but not for the usual reasons. PvE definitely holds up on its own so I don't even need to check how PvP goes.

Posted: February 5
Early Access Review
								Once again a hit by The Behemoth. They make games. And right now it's 3/3 (4/4 if you include Alien Hominid, who hasn't played that on a school computer?).I fell in love with the music of Castle Crashers, and I can tell you, this music will not disappoint. Neither will the dialogue or the voice over. And even with the, currently, rather short story, in this early access period it has so much potential. With the side quests there might even be an unlimited potential. The gameplay is simple, but immensely versatile. Controlling your characters is one click per character. You tell them where to go, and they do what they do. If you program a key on your mouse to be the space-key (or if there is a mouse-function in-game that I haven't discovered just yet) you can play this solely with the mouse, or keyboard, or controller, whatever you prefer.The game already has an amazing amount of cusomization. I am constantly checking which swords/mallets/shields/helmets/special items to give to which characters. And then we have the amount of different characters. When I tell a friend about which recruit I got this time, or just recently about how I captured a Gorgon and how she is now my Hero, just because of her abilities, he asked me what a Gorgon was. He didn't encounter one just yet. We are still early game, but the range of different characters to capture is already well on its way to become huge.I understand that this is still Early Access. Some might be thinking "What if this is all that there is to it?" Don't. This develepor is known for quality products. I can't tell you how much fun I've had in Castle Crashers. Just on my own, laughing at some moment during some quest, just because of the dialogue or visual representations. This game already has the comedy down. In the first 30 minutes of the "tutorial" there were definitely 3 good jokes.Overall, this game has already proven its worth. Smooth gameplay, smooth dialogue, smooth transitions. You start the game, the game explains you how to play, while you are playing. Then it wishes you good luck, and you are off while some being who doesn't like order narrates your story.Well worth the 15 euros.

Posted: January 17
Early Access Review
								This is an amazing game right now, but there are some major areas that could use improvment.This review will only be listing the flaws, but rest assured, it earns that positive rating.-No Zoom in or outThis is vital to nearly all SRPGS, being able to zoom out to see most, if not all of the battle field at all times. This allows for the best and most tactical disicions possible, and give the player all the info they need without hassle.In this game, your constantly looking through bonoculars magnetically taped to your forehead by Stamper with no way of taking them off because of that metal plate you goit in your head.Seriosuly, why did you think that was a good idea?-Not many Varried objectivesMost maps boil down to "Kill the enemy". While this is a fine, morally Upstanding goal, it can get a tad boring at times. The few defend and seiges maps work greatat showing the strengths and weaknesses of each race, class, unit, and otherwise.However, when the Maps are almost entirly "Kill these guys", it makes some units undeniably better then others, such as Fredrick.Speaking of which...-Fredrick is too PowerfulI though I was done with him when I was finshed with Awakening for the 7th time.I though I had found a game without a ludicrusly Overpowered unit.I was wrong.Fredrick the Cyclops, with his long flowing Magenta hair, Tiny turtle shell sheild, and Nucular Bomb Club, was far too powerful for the rest of my units too keep up. Even taking up two slots wasn't enough to stop this deminsiopn hopping monstrosity. His two move seemd like a reasonable nerf.HA.That was only so the enemies could pickl a god and pray one last time before their inevitable demise.The only map he ever struggled with was the Lumberjack one, and that's 'cuse he hate's lumberjacks and long distances.Nothing could stand up to him, not even other cyclopses.When the undead came crawling, he put them back in the grave. He wasn't afraid to kil. Again and again.It didn't matter that he took damage from his bomb.It didn't even mater that we lacked a healer for most of the game.Fredrick could not be killed.Fredrick could not be stopped.Fredrick was a force of nature.And it wasn't enough he was that strong, he was ALWAYS the one talking too. He was the leader of this rag tag group he called a team. Sure, his ego was about as through the roof as his strength, but he had twice as much bite for every bark you'd even THINK he had.But, as amazing as he is, all good things must end. Fredrick is too overpowered. I'd be happy to see him nerfed, in exchange for seeing him more in the story, with his FLowing purple, deep, muscly voice and suprisingly sensable values.-The terrain sometimes black the veiw of the unitsDespite how massive Fredick is even compared to other cyclopses, there were times where the terrain even obscured HIM. Just making the terrain a unit is standing behind less opaque would solve this issue immediately.-The healers don't heal enough'nuff said. You need two to make them even think about being useful, and even then, that's a slot that could be used to bring ANOTHER cyclops to use with Fredrick.-More unique weaponsI want more weapons that DO things.I love re-skins as much as the next guy, but it can make it hard to tell what some enemies are capable of, and that can SUCK. Besides, it would make getting a new weapon exciting rathen then "Oh, what's this reskin?"-Sopfia SucksI understand that the "Capture" unit shouldn't be a godess. But COME ON, she is SO WEAK compared to everyone else. If she had visable utility outside of capturing, like maybe some abilities to help with defend of seige maps, that might make her useful. But, since every map is "Kil, Kill, KILL" she's an active detriment. Besides, once you capture Fredrick, there is no need to capture anyone else, so she becomes useless.-Status effects SuckTheres no point to avaoiding them because they suck so much.-More unique charactersI like how Gluten got his own side quest. I want more units like him, who get some soft of quest to go along with them.I would say restrict the quests so you HAVE to have them in your party, though. For story reasons.-Show more of the other main characters in the storyHoratio and Pimpstella are suprisingly engaging characters, but I felt myself wondering during some of these scenes "Where's Yslove? Where's Sofia? Where's Glutan? Where's Fredrick?"These are all characters introduced in the main story, but never get any appearences in the main story, and rarely appear in sidequests (Aside from Yslove). Even if they are not present, they should have at least a little more of an impact.-PVP's kinda crapWhen your losing, there's not many ways to "Win". Though, this is more of an SRPG problem then just this game, so that's why it's last.-Tell us what our team is strong and weak aginst when we build itThis is more of a request, but I want to see what our team is most effective against and what their weakest to, both Map-wise and Enemy wise. I want to see the game itself acknowledge Fredrick is overpowered. Those purple locks just make him too good.All in all, great game, but I clearly see why it's in early acess.I understand Fredrick must be nerfed, But I'd prefer it done in more clever ways, and to see him intereact more with the story.Good luck on your game development, Gentlemen, And I shall be off!Fredrick, Pull our cart away!

Posted: January 16
Early Access Review
								Knight, move to A55Person reading this, move to "Add to Cart"What are you waiting forOk now for the serious review.I've recently completed story mode for Pit People (Yet to complete all Achievements, I WILL do it!), and the game has everything I personally wanted from the game. good Story development, a villian you can hate for a reason, and really funny jokes.With Early Acess, It has all the content for a small story, If it was only this for the final release, I'd personally enjoy it. Honestly I'm going to rack up my Characters to level 99 and completely MELT the Pit! Oh you're thinking of the 1000 Degree knife?The story adds on to the "Behemoth" Timeline. If you're wondering what game this is going off of, it's going off of Battleblock Theater. If you don't believe me, buy the game and beat it.Mechanics in the game are well-executed (personally, in my opinion). It introduces a Hexagonal Turn-base mechanic where you have to use Geometry to make any sense out of this.. (Note, you don't have to have that much knowledge).Will Stamper, there's Will Stamper. They got the legendary comedian Will Stamper. Just like Battleblock Theater, I might have a reason to beat the game.Unlike any Early Acess Games, I couldn't find any bugs when just casually playing it. It's well constructed, and like I said earlier, It feels like this is the full game.If you, the reader, are reading this, I highly recommend you buy this.  If you can spare $15, just buy this, buy this for your family, and buy it for your dog.

Posted: January 26
Early Access Review
Another Great Behemoth game...After finishing Castle Crashers and collecting all the weapons that i don't have to grind like hell for and playing some Battle Block Theater but not being able to continue because i have no real friends to play it ( Such a shame, really. ) , i think that this game was a great addition to the small set of overwhelmingly positive games that Behemoth has made over the years. Anyway, heres the review :Pros:  +Very strategic team building. If you're into that kinda strategy games, then you will like this game for sure. You have a whole lot of weapons to choose from, a lot of races ( Cyclopses, robots, zombies etc. ) that each have different abilities or bonusses to stuff. +A lot of customisation. This is pretty much the base of the game. There are over 1300 collectibles, ranging from bows to hats for your cute but at the same time terrifying hair troll. +Balanced Difficulty. If you don't suck a lot at strategy games or if you don't accept a 5 skull difficulty quest ( You won't be seeing those at the start anyways but still. ) right away with only 4 members, you won't be overwhelmed or underwhelmed by the difficulty. If you somehow feel underwhelmed then there is an insane mode in the town. +Co-Op. Now, i won't get into this much because i have not been able to try it yet but from my experiences with co-op on other Behemoth games, i am sure that this game has a really fun co-op too. Also there is online co-op too so yeah, that is cool. +Cool soundtrack. The soundtrack of the game feels really in place, in fights, in menu, in town... You would know if you played other Behemoth games, that funky but catchy music. +Big World. Although the biomes are not that diverse, i found it quite entertaining to explore the world and find new races ( You won't keep seeing new ones, you will probably find them all after a few hours of gameplay if you explore around the map. ) . There are also over 100 biomes. Honestly i wouldn't really call them ''biomes''. They are more like places, ranging from a robot city to a grasslands filled with fruits and sweets. +Pokemon. If you like catching pokemon, then you will like this aspect of the game. As long as you buy cages from the shop at the town before you leave, you will be able to catch anything or anyone you can fight. After you catch them you can use their equipment, you can use them for fighting, or you can just keep them with other 127 fighters that have lost to you and you have either caught them because you liked their clothing or your catcher just had to be next to it and you caught it by a mistake. +Overall great srategy game. The team building aspect combined with the soundtrack, the funky graphics, the funny voices and the dope turn-based combat, the game becomes fun to play but strategic and sometimes hard at the same time. +Also gives you cool stuff if you own Battle Block Theater and Castle Crashers.Cons: - Progressing feels so... dull. While playing the game, it will start to feel like you are stuck in a loop, go to town, look through your loot ( Which generally isn't anything more or stronger than cosmetics. ) , buy more cages just in case you see something cool, choose a quest, get out of the town, kill stuff, catch stuff, do your quest or just return to town without doing it because either your inventory is full or your party has a few people dead and a few people low on health, go back to town anyways, check your loot, and repeat. Yes, a lot of stuff you can get - but after a while that also starts to feel boring, because most of the time you will just find stuff either you don't use or don't look good enough. Also they could be weaker, nobody knows because there is not really a place where you could get better loot, you just revolve around the same place and kill the same enemies with different clothing. Yes, there is levelling - but levelling... Oh boy, you don't get anything for levelling, well you do get that sometimes really helpful boost to full health, but other than that you don't get anything other than numbers that show you your level. No health boost, no damage boost... No nothin' . Well you do have the main storyline quests but meh... - UI. It feels like the UI is kind of hard to use. At the start it will be hard to understand what does what while you work through your team. But that is a really small con because you get used to it quickly. - How limited you are. This is the second biggest con after progressing, you want to carry more loot before going back near the town to empty your wagon? Too bad! You can't upgrade it! You just got a reaaally cool looking weapon but it's too heavy? Yeah, sorry but you can't change how much you carry. You want to have a cyclops in your team to carry that? Cyclopses take 2 places in your team so it is not worth it. To clear some misunderstandings, i am not saying that cyclopses taking 2 spaces is bad, i think that is completely balanced because they are pretty strong and tanky compared to humans. -Body armor. Although this might not matter much, in my opinion it does for a game that heavly depends on customisation. You can't change what your team wears. You can only change their helmets. This kind of sucks. I don't like having a giant cyclops with a Dat Boi head ( Yup, there is a Dat Boi head, and also a lot of other memes and references so that's cool. ) but with a white body. I don't want a human with a badass knight helmet but with only a gray casual shirt on.I know I listed too many cons, but honestly, the pros overwhelm them. TL;DR: The game is fun and challenging at the same time. You got over 1300 collectibles. Over 100 places to see - I wouldn't suggest getting too excited over this as those places are just different looking squares that you will get from side to side in only 30 seconds but it's still cool seeing new stuff. A lot of detail into team building. Although the progressing feels kinda dull it is still really fun to collect stuff. Overall great game that is fun but srategical, i would suggest buying it.Another great game by Behemoth.8/10

								Now let me tell you a story about dadgum.I had a 6 people who were kinda high level3 humans who were around level 30a robot who was around level 20and dadgum who was a hair troll and around level 20During the first fight 2 humans and my robot died but we won the round.since i only had a human who was at low health and dadgum who was almost at max health I thought that we were going to die and lose.Boy was I wrongDadgum and the human charged the weakest dude.While they did kill the dude my human died.But dadgum charged the archersHe killed them one by one as the giants chased after him.He killed the archers and now theres only 3 enemys left1 mushroom and 2 giantsDadgum runs around to regain health before charging the mushroom.By now Dadgum is at low health.Dadgum levels up and gets max health while fighting the mushroomDadgum then goes for one of the giantsDadgum kills the giant.By now Dadgum is at low health againUntil he levels upHe takes the remaining giant onDadgum easily beats himNext and finally roundIts Dadgum vs a ton of peopleHe kills all the weak kolboldsHe then kills the snake ladyThen he kills the remaining giants somehowDadgum wins Now lets talk about the game itself. This allows for the best and most tactical disicions possible, and give the player all the info they need without hassle.In this game, your constantly looking through bonoculars magnetically taped to your forehead by Stamper with no way of taking them off because of that metal plate you goit in your head.Seriosuly, why did you think that was a good idea?-Not many Varried objectivesMost maps boil down to "Kill the enemy". While this is a fine, morally Upstanding goal, it can get a tad boring at times. The few defend and seiges maps work greatat showing the strengths and weaknesses of each race, class, unit, and otherwise.However, when the Maps are almost entirly "Kill these guys", it makes some units undeniably better then others, such as Fredrick.Speaking of which...-Fredrick is too PowerfulI though I was done with him when I was finshed with Awakening for the 7th time.I though I had found a game without a ludicrusly Overpowered unit.I was wrong.Fredrick the Cyclops, with his long flowing Magenta hair, Tiny turtle shell sheild, and Nucular Bomb Club, was far too powerful for the rest of my units too keep up. Even taking up two slots wasn't enough to stop this deminsiopn hopping monstrosity. His two move seemd like a reasonable nerf.HA.That was only so the enemies could pickl a god and pray one last time before their inevitable demise.The only map he ever struggled with was the Lumberjack one, and that's 'cuse he hate's lumberjacks and long distances.Nothing could stand up to him, not even other cyclopses.When the undead came crawling, he put them back in the grave. He wasn't afraid to kil. Again and again.It didn't matter that he took damage from his bomb.It didn't even mater that we lacked a healer for most of the game.Fredrick could not be killed.Fredrick could not be stopped.Fredrick was a force of nature.And it wasn't enough he was that strong, he was ALWAYS the one talking too. He was the leader of this rag tag group he called a team. Sure, his ego was about as through the roof as his strength, but he had twice as much bite for every bark you'd even THINK he had.But, as amazing as he is, all good things must end. Fredrick is too overpowered. I'd be happy to see him nerfed, in exchange for seeing him more in the story, with his FLowing purple, deep, muscly voice and suprisingly sensable values.-The terrain sometimes black the veiw of the unitsDespite how massive Fredick is even compared to other cyclopses, there were times where the terrain even obscured HIM. Just making the terrain a unit is standing behind less opaque would solve this issue immediately.-The healers don't heal enough'nuff said. You need two to make them even think about being useful, and even then, that's a slot that could be used to bring ANOTHER cyclops to use with Fredrick.-More unique weaponsI want more weapons that DO things.I love re-skins as much as the next guy, but it can make it hard to tell what some enemies are capable of, and that can SUCK. Besides, it would make getting a new weapon exciting rathen then "Oh, what's this reskin?"-Sopfia SucksI understand that the "Capture" unit shouldn't be a godess. But COME ON, she is SO WEAK compared to everyone else. If she had visable utility outside of capturing, like maybe some abilities to help with defend of seige maps, that might make her useful. But, since every map is "Kil, Kill, KILL" she's an active detriment. Besides, once you capture Fredrick, there is no need to capture anyone else, so she becomes useless.-Status effects SuckTheres no point to avaoiding them because they suck so much.-More unique charactersI like how Gluten got his own side quest. I want more units like him, who get some soft of quest to go along with them.I would say restrict the quests so you HAVE to have them in your party, though. For story reasons.-Show more of the other main characters in the storyHoratio and Pimpstella are suprisingly engaging characters, but I felt myself wondering during some of these scenes "Where's Yslove? Where's Sofia? Where's Glutan? Where's Fredrick?"These are all characters introduced in the main story, but never get any appearences in the main story, and rarely appear in sidequests (Aside from Yslove). Even if they are not present, they should have at least a little more of an impact.-PVP's kinda crapWhen your losing, there's not many ways to "Win". Though, this is more of an SRPG problem then just this game, so that's why it's last.-Tell us what our team is strong and weak aginst when we build itThis is more of a request, but I want to see what our team is most effective against and what their weakest to, both Map-wise and Enemy wise. I want to see the game itself acknowledge Fredrick is overpowered. Those purple locks just make him too good.All in all, great game, but I clearly see why it's in early acess.I understand Fredrick must be nerfed, But I'd prefer it done in more clever ways, and to see him intereact more with the story.Good luck on your game development, Gentlemen, And I shall be off!Fredrick, Pull our cart away!

Posted: January 16
Early Access Review
								I'm excited to see the limited amount of content grow. Behemoth has always done a great job putting together unique games with their own sense of humor and style. As of early access, they still deliever with their signature style. The art of Dan Paladin is ever present. Simple, humorous, delightful. There were a few times the art was pixelated but I'm sure that'll be fixed. Some of it (art, map, UI) feels a bit overly busy. As far as content, UI, and fighting system, alot needs to be worked on. The fighting system is simple but shallow and there's two story missions along with a few side quests. I imagine over the next year (in which Behemoth works towards release) mechanics and story will be built upon. So if you're buying it now, know you're only going to get a few hours of enjoyment at first. But if you believe the track record of the Behemoth team and their wonderfully unique spirit, it's worth to get the game now and support the team!

Posted: February 7
Early Access Review
								You know I wasn't going to write a review for this game untill it cam out of Early Access but god damn is this game fun! I've just finished the main story and to be honest I can't wait for the future parts of story mode to come out. The artstyle is great with lots of detail put into every part of the map (the bouncing houses are my favourites). The battle system works really well too. At first I thought it was going to be chaotc nd confusing like a turn based castle crashers but this game actually made me put a lot of stagety into each turn. You see one of my party members is a unicorn which in this game is a motar tower. Each turn I have to move into a place where it hits the enemy but also so it doesn't it my other team members. Oh and the healing, oh the healing. The healing in this game workss really well. Basically your healers in this game are some strangely sexy cupcakes that take damage when they heal you since it is feeding its body to you. However my cupcake has never died because like I said this game brought out the strategist in me so my cupcake was always in the safest place. Once again the classic Behemouth humour is in this game which is always welcome and Stamper returns to voice the best video game villain of 2017 so far. I highly recommend this game to everyone especially fans of fire emblem and other turn based strategy games. Just like teeny tiny iced creams, I know you'll love it. ;)

Posted: February 7
Early Access Review
								First of all: I rarely ever buy into Early access games these days, to many times have I been burnt by games that were pretty much abandonned before they were finished. Therefore I was a little hesitant to buy this one, but ultimatily decided to do so, because the Behemoth is a studio that made 2 really good games already(battleblock theater beeing one of my favourit plattformers of all time).I went in, expecting a casual strategie game, but I got was so much more!The humor just makes me smile, which few games manage to do these days, but there is just so much detail and intersting stuff everywhere in the world, that I just can't help but aimlessly wander around, looking forward to what kind of adventure is gonna happen next!The gameplay itself is a simpel, but solid strategiegame, with a unique approch to local and online multiplayer.My personal favourit though, is the "Pokemon"-aspect of the game, letting you capture pretty much anything you encounter in battle. More often then not, I find myself doing quests in very difficult ways, just so I can save the "boss" of said quest till last, so I will be able to capture it and put it in my team(I especially like having Lady Ladylegs and Yosef in the same team), after outfitting it with a ♥♥♥♥♥on of cosmetics first!You can blast through the 2 mainstoryquests that are already in quite fast, most of my playtime was seeking out sidestorys(which I love to do, because all of them are hillarious) and capturing whatever boss is at the very end, although I still haven't found all of them.Of course, since this is an early access review, things might change drasticly at any point of the development process, but I see an insane potential, that just increases with every new capturable creature you put in this awesome world!

Posted: February 7
Early Access Review
								You know I wasn't going to write a review for this game untill it cam out of Early Access but god damn is this game fun! I've just finished the main story and to be honest I can't wait for the future parts of story mode to come out. The artstyle is great with lots of detail put into every part of the map (the bouncing houses are my favourites). The battle system works really well too. At first I thought it was going to be chaotc nd confusing like a turn based castle crashers but this game actually made me put a lot of stagety into each turn. You see one of my party members is a unicorn which in this game is a motar tower. Each turn I have to move into a place where it hits the enemy but also so it doesn't it my other team members. Oh and the healing, oh the healing. The healing in this game workss really well. Basically your healers in this game are some strangely sexy cupcakes that take damage when they heal you since it is feeding its body to you. However my cupcake has never died because like I said this game brought out the strategist in me so my cupcake was always in the safest place. Once again the classic Behemouth humour is in this game which is always welcome and Stamper returns to voice the best video game villain of 2017 so far. I highly recommend this game to everyone especially fans of fire emblem and other turn based strategy games. Just like teeny tiny iced creams, I know you'll love it. ;)

Posted: January 23
Early Access Review
								Highly recommended, especially for fans of The Behemoth.At the time of this review the game is in early access and only contains about 1-2 hours of campaign, but there is much more to do after you've finished what's been released so far.Pit People is an easily accessible, turn-based, tactical/strategy game. In the campaign you start out with a small party of weird-o heroes who traverse an open world searching for quests, loot, revenge, and fighters. As you progress you are able to capture enemies and collect gear to add to your armory, giving you the chance to fine tune your party into a ruthless quad-killing machine.After completing what's available of the main story line you and your party are given free reign of the world. As you grab more fighters and gear you're encouraged to put them to the test in the pit where your party is pitted against "unfair AI" or other players online.The campaign and side quests are brimming with moxie. This whole game is just full of it, even the environment dances to the upbeat soundtrack.PROS:-Local and online CO-OP-Online multiplayer VS-Fantastic hex turn-based combat-AI brawling-Easy to access, difficult to master-HIlarious-RPG-ish elements that get the "ooo! numbers going up!" part of your brain tingling-Lots of stuff to collect-Lots of stuff to explore-Insane difficult mode-Ability to refuse space-bear's commands and not dieCONS:-It's in early access, but some minor UI issues.-At this point in time the campaign is very short, but you're getting it for cheap and there is so much more to do than the campaign.In conclusion:If you love Behemoth games and want to play it now, get it, it's worth it and in a completely playable state. If you don't like the idea of a short campaign maybe purchase it now at the lowered price and leave it in your backlog until the whole game is released.

Posted: February 5
Early Access Review
								Once again a hit by The Behemoth. They make games. And right now it's 3/3 (4/4 if you include Alien Hominid, who hasn't played that on a school computer?).I fell in love with the music of Castle Crashers, and I can tell you, this music will not disappoint. Neither will the dialogue or the voice over. And even with the, currently, rather short story, in this early access period it has so much potential. With the side quests there might even be an unlimited potential. The gameplay is simple, but immensely versatile. Controlling your characters is one click per character. You tell them where to go, and they do what they do. If you program a key on your mouse to be the space-key (or if there is a mouse-function in-game that I haven't discovered just yet) you can play this solely with the mouse, or keyboard, or controller, whatever you prefer.The game already has an amazing amount of cusomization. I am constantly checking which swords/mallets/shields/helmets/special items to give to which characters. And then we have the amount of different characters. When I tell a friend about which recruit I got this time, or just recently about how I captured a Gorgon and how she is now my Hero, just because of her abilities, he asked me what a Gorgon was. He didn't encounter one just yet. We are still early game, but the range of different characters to capture is already well on its way to become huge.I understand that this is still Early Access. Some might be thinking "What if this is all that there is to it?" Don't. This develepor is known for quality products. I can't tell you how much fun I've had in Castle Crashers. Just on my own, laughing at some moment during some quest, just because of the dialogue or visual representations. This game already has the comedy down. In the first 30 minutes of the "tutorial" there were definitely 3 good jokes.Overall, this game has already proven its worth. Smooth gameplay, smooth dialogue, smooth transitions. You start the game, the game explains you how to play, while you are playing. Then it wishes you good luck, and you are off while some being who doesn't like order narrates your story.Well worth the 15 euros.

Posted: January 26
Early Access Review
Another Great Behemoth game...After finishing Castle Crashers and collecting all the weapons that i don't have to grind like hell for and playing some Battle Block Theater but not being able to continue because i have no real friends to play it ( Such a shame, really. ) , i think that this game was a great addition to the small set of overwhelmingly positive games that Behemoth has made over the years. Anyway, heres the review :Pros:  +Very strategic team building. If you're into that kinda strategy games, then you will like this game for sure. You have a whole lot of weapons to choose from, a lot of races ( Cyclopses, robots, zombies etc. ) that each have different abilities or bonusses to stuff. +A lot of customisation. This is pretty much the base of the game. There are over 1300 collectibles, ranging from bows to hats for your cute but at the same time terrifying hair troll. +Balanced Difficulty. If you don't suck a lot at strategy games or if you don't accept a 5 skull difficulty quest ( You won't be seeing those at the start anyways but still. ) right away with only 4 members, you won't be overwhelmed or underwhelmed by the difficulty. If you somehow feel underwhelmed then there is an insane mode in the town. +Co-Op. Now, i won't get into this much because i have not been able to try it yet but from my experiences with co-op on other Behemoth games, i am sure that this game has a really fun co-op too. Also there is online co-op too so yeah, that is cool. +Cool soundtrack. The soundtrack of the game feels really in place, in fights, in menu, in town... You would know if you played other Behemoth games, that funky but catchy music. +Big World. Although the biomes are not that diverse, i found it quite entertaining to explore the world and find new races ( You won't keep seeing new ones, you will probably find them all after a few hours of gameplay if you explore around the map. ) . There are also over 100 biomes. Honestly i wouldn't really call them ''biomes''. They are more like places, ranging from a robot city to a grasslands filled with fruits and sweets. +Pokemon. If you like catching pokemon, then you will like this aspect of the game. As long as you buy cages from the shop at the town before you leave, you will be able to catch anything or anyone you can fight. After you catch them you can use their equipment, you can use them for fighting, or you can just keep them with other 127 fighters that have lost to you and you have either caught them because you liked their clothing or your catcher just had to be next to it and you caught it by a mistake. +Overall great srategy game. The team building aspect combined with the soundtrack, the funky graphics, the funny voices and the dope turn-based combat, the game becomes fun to play but strategic and sometimes hard at the same time. +Also gives you cool stuff if you own Battle Block Theater and Castle Crashers.Cons: - Progressing feels so... dull. While playing the game, it will start to feel like you are stuck in a loop, go to town, look through your loot ( Which generally isn't anything more or stronger than cosmetics. ) , buy more cages just in case you see something cool, choose a quest, get out of the town, kill stuff, catch stuff, do your quest or just return to town without doing it because either your inventory is full or your party has a few people dead and a few people low on health, go back to town anyways, check your loot, and repeat. Yes, a lot of stuff you can get - but after a while that also starts to feel boring, because most of the time you will just find stuff either you don't use or don't look good enough. Also they could be weaker, nobody knows because there is not really a place where you could get better loot, you just revolve around the same place and kill the same enemies with different clothing. Yes, there is levelling - but levelling... Oh boy, you don't get anything for levelling, well you do get that sometimes really helpful boost to full health, but other than that you don't get anything other than numbers that show you your level. No health boost, no damage boost... No nothin' . Well you do have the main storyline quests but meh... - UI. It feels like the UI is kind of hard to use. At the start it will be hard to understand what does what while you work through your team. But that is a really small con because you get used to it quickly. - How limited you are. This is the second biggest con after progressing, you want to carry more loot before going back near the town to empty your wagon? Too bad! You can't upgrade it! You just got a reaaally cool looking weapon but it's too heavy? Yeah, sorry but you can't change how much you carry. You want to have a cyclops in your team to carry that? Cyclopses take 2 places in your team so it is not worth it. To clear some misunderstandings, i am not saying that cyclopses taking 2 spaces is bad, i think that is completely balanced because they are pretty strong and tanky compared to humans. -Body armor. Although this might not matter much, in my opinion it does for a game that heavly depends on customisation. You can't change what your team wears. You can only change their helmets. This kind of sucks. I don't like having a giant cyclops with a Dat Boi head ( Yup, there is a Dat Boi head, and also a lot of other memes and references so that's cool. ) but with a white body. I don't want a human with a badass knight helmet but with only a gray casual shirt on.I know I listed too many cons, but honestly, the pros overwhelm them. TL;DR: The game is fun and challenging at the same time. You got over 1300 collectibles. Over 100 places to see - I wouldn't suggest getting too excited over this as those places are just different looking squares that you will get from side to side in only 30 seconds but it's still cool seeing new stuff. A lot of detail into team building. Although the progressing feels kinda dull it is still really fun to collect stuff. Overall great game that is fun but srategical, i would suggest buying it.Another great game by Behemoth.8/10

Posted: January 22
Early Access Review
								I absolutely love this game, and I will always recommend Behemoth games.This is a turn based strategy game, as you may know.You may also know that this is in Early Access, so I will keep that in mind when I state my opinion.Pros:-The game is very fun, even in its early development days.-This game is comedic and fun, as all the Behemoth games are.-This game is a great breath of fresh air; its hard to find a good game with a fighting style similar to a turn based hex game.-Get similar to Castle Crashers and Battleblock Theatre out of your head; this is only similar in art and graphics.-So far, I have found no bugs whatsoever, which is amazing, considering this is in Early Access.Cons:-Some of the menus are unintuitive and hard to browse through, such as the character accessory and selection menus in the house at the city. The menus are also a bit confusing at times. This is my biggest annoyance.-I'm typing this while in game, and I have no idea how to save unless it saves automatically.-Fighting can become a nuisance at times with the battling strategies. Theres no real guide to show you what everything does or reminders, you just kinda have to remember everything.-The online system is a bit wonky and needs tweaking.There aren't many cons, but the cons listed really Bees my Movie. And if it all came down to it, yes. Yes you should buy this game. Immediately. It is so much fun beyond belief.

Posted: January 22
Early Access Review
								Just what you'd expect from The Behemoth. This game is amazing! Despite it being early access and in reality there is very little to it right now, I've had a lot of fun with it.IF YOU BUY THIS EARLY, DO KNOW THAT THERE IS ONLY THE GENERAL SET OF TUTORIAL QUESTS AND WHAT FEELS LIKE ONLY 1 REAL STORY QUEST. Most of my time playing has been spent just grinding out battles in order to level up my team, otherwise there really isn't much else to do other than the Unfair Pit and repeatable bonus missions. The Unfair Pit seems quite fun, but even with a full team of above level 20's I barely made it past round 1 and it could also be noted that I'm probably not amazing at the game anyway. As far as random encounters go, I feel like it would be nice to see even more variety in some of the enemies. There are a few different races you encounter throughout the game, but the only difference between characters of the same race are there helmets mostly and even then it really isn't all that crazy. Each race of character has their own style of attacking and special attributes, and there are actually quite a few different races, but after playing for awhile I would either get a lack of variety in the enemies I was facing or cool races just wouldn't show up at all. This game is early access so I wasn't expecting it to be all together or anywhere near a complete game. I've had a lot of fun with the game so far, but until its full releases I don't think I'll be playing too much now. I absolutely recommend getting this game now while it's cheaper though. It is an insane amount of fun and it's only in early access so it can only get better from here.

Posted: January 23
Early Access Review
								I don't write many reviews, because I really don't have the time or desire to be a part-time games journalist (for free).  But, this is one of the most objectively FUN games I've played in a long time.  Combat is a blast, the narrator is great and interjects at just the right time to add flavor to a kill ("That's fair.....I guess."), and there are so many combinations to make battlegroups out of.  While the loot varies mostly as cosmetic alterations of core types, you still get a feeling that you're constantly winning something.  The locations and character names are hilarious, and I've already gotten a warning from my wife that I have to make sure my son isn't around when I'm playing (apparently she doesn't want him saying "Rumptrumpet" at school).I'm not great at adding funny things to reviews, but I'd give this game a solid 10/10, would recommend friends buy it again.

Posted: February 10
Early Access Review
								Pit People is a one of those 'Easy to play, hard to master' types. It's fast to finish your turn just a few clicks, that's right, there's no special type of attacks your charcters can use. It's more about type type of charcters and types of equipment that just leveling up.This game also features pvp, very fun and easy to start playing, there was not once i felt like i was under leveled or overleveled in pvp, but like i was outplayed or someone with more knowleage than me. You get rewarded with gold and points by completing these pvp (you can also play with the AI but you have to go though extra rounds) The points are your rank, there are three stages. Bronze, Siver and Gold. The higher the better the rewards are.Not going to give out spoliers but i'll say this game has pretty good comady with the story, but a bit short because the game is still in beta.The charcters you get are fun and different to use, like humans,  they can use different types of swords, clubs, bows and some throwable stuff. The Cyclops who can gaint weapeons, clubs and send people flying! There is even cupcakes, wraths and other scary and funny allys(or foes)I'll give this game a 7.5. Abit hard to get into and lacks story, but theres is so many laughs and adventures to be had in this game! Have Fun!

Early Access Review
								Ok so this is another game by the Behemoth and it is amazing I'm a huge fan of Castle Crashers and BattleBlock Theater so obviosly I would want to play Pit People. I started playing and was already thrown into classic Behemoth Humor, the art style in this game is the same as CC and BBT which is really good cause I really like the Behemoth's art style in games. This is a srategy game and thats pretty diffrent from BBT which was a platformer and CC which was just pretty much a combat game with sword fighting. It is open world and running into enemies will start a fight like in most RPG's so yeah if you don't want to fight don't run into them cause there is no fleeing feature. Also when in the open world map make sure not to get lost cause I couldn't find the main town for about 15 minutes due to the fact the world is so big with no arrows or signs or whatever telling you where it is so don't get lost like I did.

Posted: February 11
Early Access Review
								Recently bought this game after seeing a few Youtubers playing, I was not dissapointed. Although, it is currently in early access if you do the side stuff there is enough content to justify buying it and it's reduced for early access buyers. I usually don't play many turn based stratergy games, but this one is has quite a quick pace and good mechanics. I really appreciate the style, jokes and genral qwerkyness of the game. The game is quite easy to pick up and has good local multiplayer. My main issues are that when different chracters have buffs you can't find out what they are. For example in the equip menu buffs have icons, but they aren't very self explanatory. If when you put your highligted them you'd get a little box of text which told you what the buff did that would be good. Also, with the Lady Legless quest I didn't have Yosef on my team and entered the quest, this then wouldn't allow me to finish the battle as she wouldn't die. When I had Yosef on my team it worked due to story reasons, prehaps if the quest didn't start without Yosef this could be fixed. The addition of ranked online battles in the pit would also be appreciated, however I'm mostly nit picking now. I really like this game and strongly recomend it.

Posted: January 22
Early Access Review
								The Behemoth is back!I've been a huge fan of this studio since Newgrounds, have played everything they have developed up to this point, and I have to say that Pit People is turning out to be one of the best efforts they have ever made. Castle Crashers was amazing for unlocks and playing through multiple times to find all of the nuances and secrets lying underneath, but after 30-40 hours you have done and seen most of what the game has to offer. Pit People is so different in that aspect, as there are literally 1,000+ items to unlock, a multitude of different characters and species to "recruit", and a billion reasons to sink your time into this game.As Early Access, the game gives you a very limited view of what is in store for the main story experience, but it vastly makes up for this with an addictive but accessible PVP and super-hard Co-Op pit mode. Not to mention the huge open world that seems to have a lot to discover, and plenty of creatures to add to your team as mentioned before.There are a few noticable and jarring UI problems with this game. For one, a lot of the stat management and overviews for characters are incredibly subtle. At first, I had no idea that leveling your recruits mattered. There's no representation of your stats growing or what the growth per individual species would be. You'll especially notice this once you recruit a Mascot species type, as their attack damage on the stats page reads a huge number above all other species, but they merely buff other characters and don't do the damage stated on their page. There needs to be more ways to differenciate between the different Clops or Humans you recruit, as well as stat comparison to someone you're wanting to swap in on your team before taking on PvP or the World Map. The UI is also very difficult to manage with a mouse + keyboard. I have been playing most of this game with the Steam Controller, and I find that method of play to be a lot more enjoyable. Playing on my laptop with a mouse and keyboard, or even my main PC, was a challenge. There's no visual feedback when you're nearing the edge of the screen in the main hub for bulding selections other than a "click your mouse" prompt, and you usually find yourself running between buildings often trying to make a simple selection. There are plenty of other examples of the UI being incredibly clunky and vague, like the Quest Selection page before you depart to the world. I had to take a few moments to grasp what they wanted me to do.I've put a good amount of hours into this game so far, and I cannot wait to see what they bring to the table with it. Definitely one of the better Early Access titles I have ever played. I see this game having such potential for updates, maybe little DLC packs for new character stories or mission packs. Hell, maybe even release these quarterly for free. I can also see a potential competitive scene emerging from this game once all the balancing has been ironed out, and most of the gameplay has been tweaked a bit.I will update this review when the game goes live, but I would highly recommend you buy this if you are on the fence about it. I would say 80% of the game is there, and what is included is well worth the $15 asking price.To the Pits!

Posted: January 21
Early Access Review
								Pit People is without a single doubt the best tactics RPG I have played in a long time. The game has all sorts of content and there will actually be more of it since it is in Early Access at the time of this review. The multiplayer is one of the most balanced of today's games and the sounds and music is top notchThe game is not without it's flaws. Because units are programmed to have minds of their own, they sometime attack certain enemies when they're suppose to attack other high-priority targets. Also, some quests have at least 3x the number of enemy untis as your army of up to six units, which creates unnecessary chaos.Overall, I highly recommend getting Pit People. It has the makings of a potential GotY candidate.
